The potentially beneficial role of traditional Chinese medicine is described in the guidelines of the NHC, and some Chinese patent medicines (CPMs) have been used to treat COVID-19.
10 However, the experience with most of these treatments is anecdotal. Gu et al. reviewed 93 Chinese medicine prescriptions and 157 forms of constituent medicines for COVID-19 treatment and found that they may be effective in reducing fever, mucous production, cough, and asthma symptoms.
64 Yan et al. discovered that 10 antiviral components from CPMs can directly bind to both host cell target angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) 2 receptor and viral target main protease, suggesting their potential for COVID-19 treatment.
